definition[0]: someone, especially a child or young person, who is mature behaves in a sensible and reasonable way, as you would expect an adult to behave
example[0]: Laura is very mature for her age.
example[1]: We’re mature enough to disagree on this issue but still respect each other.
example[2]: Mature apple trees are typically 20 feet tall.
example[3]: The new leader wants his country to be seen as a mature democracy.
example[4]: The human brain isn’t fully mature until about age 25.
example[5]: Most girls are sexually mature by about 14 years of age.
definition[2]: mature cheese, wine etc has a good strong taste which has developed during a long period of time
definition[3]: a polite or humorous way of describing someone who is no longer young
example[8]: a respectable gentleman of mature years
definition[4]: a mature piece of work by a writer or an artist is done late in their life and shows a high level of understanding or skill
example[9]: His mature work reveals a deep sense of enjoyment of nature.
definition[5]: a mature bond or policy is ready to be paid
definition[6]: to become fully grown or developed
example[10]: As the fish matures, its colours and patternings change.
example[11]: She has matured into a fine writer.
definition[7]: to become sensible and start to behave sensibly and reasonably, like an adult
example[12]: He has matured a lot since he left home.
example[13]: He wants to prove just how much he has matured both as a player and as a man.
definition[8]: if a financial arrangement such as a bond or an insurance policy matures, it becomes ready to be paid
definition[9]: if cheese, wine etc matures, or if it is matured, it develops a good strong taste over a period of time
example[14]: Few beers brewed in Britain are matured in the bottle.
example[15]: The olives are pulped, then left to mature.
definition[10]: if a financial arrangement such as a bond or an INSURANCE POLICY matures, it becomes ready to be paid
example[16]: The debentures will mature in five years’ time.
example[17]: The country’s economy has matured and become more open to competition.
definition[12]: if an industry or market matures, it stops growing as fast as before, and the number of competitors decreases
example[18]: When the market begins to mature, it is increasingly difficult for new entrants to gain a significant position.
definition[13]: a mature industry or market is one where growth is relatively low and there are fewer competitors than before
example[19]: Many emerging markets have outpaced  (=developed more quickly than) more mature markets such as the U.S. and Japan.
